intro: Centaurium, commonly known as lesser centaury, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Gentianaceae. It consists of about 40 species, most of which are native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. The plants typically have basal leaves and small, showy blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. They are often found in grassy areas, meadows, and along roadsides. Centaurium species are generally herbaceous and can be either annual or perennial, depending on the species.
